QUESTION
I am a white English male ?revert? and have been good friends with a Muslim sister for a few years now. We both used to work at the same work place and got talking thru my curiosity of Islam, infact the way this person talked and explained about Islam and the love for our creator had a major effect on me and after a solid 8/9 months of my own research Alhamdulilah I pronounced my shahada 4 months ago. We have both been of a great encouragement for each in striving to remain steadfast within our deen and helping each other over come issues within ourselves. We have talked about marriage and both feel we would be compatible partners, but the problem, this sister is of Asian origin and as tradition plays a major part in her family life the fact that I am not of the same ?cast? is going to be a major problem. Can you please tell if there is anything in ahadith or the Holy Quran that will help support us when trying to explain to family etc... that in the eyes of our lord, most high > we are both Muslims so there should be no problem.

Masha Allah welcome to Islaam. May Allah Ta'ala make you from HIS beloved%0D%0Achosen friends. Dear Brother however at this stage first clarify your%0D%0Aacceptance of Islaam, is it because of your love for this Muslim sister or%0D%0Ais it because your true love for Islaam. Remember human beings do have%0D%0Ashortfalls and if this relationship does not work, will you give up Islaam?%0D%0AAfter clarifying this then address the issue of nikaah, yes truly Allah%0D%0ATa'ala does not look at shape, nor colour but rather look at 'taqwa' in you%0D%0Ai.e. fear of Allah Ta'ala if one transgressors the boundaries and Love for%0D%0AAllah Ta'ala who is so Loving, Caring, Kind and wants to please us not%0D%0Apunish us.%0D%0A%0D%0AIt is rather unfortunate that people do submit to pressure of culture and%0D%0Anorms of society. Make Istikhaara by performing 2 rakaats salaah with%0D%0Aintention if this girl is a good partner in marriage for you. You may dream%0D%0Aof which may interpreted by certain qualified Ulema (You may ask the Imam)%0D%0Aor you may have a positivity or negativity about marriage. If you do go%0D%0Aahead, be prepared for resistance however, perform simple nikaah, no fancies%0D%0Aand have a Walimah if you can afford to.%0D%0A%0D%0AFurthermore you may win the family with love, smile and give them gifts,%0D%0Aetc. and make lots of dua.%0D%0A%0D%0ANB Avoid relationship as that is the evil arrow of shaitaan leading to%0D%0Aadultery of eyes, hands, heart etc...to final act. However if you or she%0D%0Awill not be able to cope with family pressure consider situation before%0D%0Agetting into something that may affect your relationship as a couple. In%0D%0Athis case end your relationship here and now. Look for a pious man in your%0D%0Aarea to learn about deen and to keep in an environment that will help build%0D%0Athe love of Our Creator Allah Ta'ala.
